results.title: An American in Paris
results.creator_credit: Adrienne Fazan, Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An American in Paris tells the story of an ex-GI art student who has fallen in love with a young French girl and then sadly has been parted from her. At their separation he reflects on his feelings towards Paris - the frustration’s, joys and miseries that have been part of his life and his falling in love. Gene Kelly teams up with Leslie Caron in this spectacularly staged musical featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin. Academy Award for Best Film 1951.

results.title: San Francisco
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke, Bernard H. Hyman, John Emerson and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A lavish production set in San Francisco, in which Clark Gable plays the role of Blackie Norton, proprietor of a riotous saloon. When Jeanette MacDonald arrives on the scene in search of a singing career, they fall in love. The climax takes place amongst the recreation of the great earthquake that hit the city in 1906. Cast also includes Spencer Tracy, Jack Holt, Jessie Ralph and Ted Healy. Screenplay by Anita Loos from the story by Robert Hopkins. Edited by Tom Neld.

results.title: The Enchanted Cottage
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Harriet Parsons and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A disfigured World War II veteran marries a decidedly plain girl and they seclude themselves inside a small New England cottage. A small miracle occurs when they are transformed into a handsome couple, as they see each other through the eyes of love. Based on the play by Sir Arthur Wing Pinero, this fable proves that beauty is in the eye of the beholder. Starring Dorothy McGuire and Robert Young.

results.title: Doctor Zhivago
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Carlo Ponti, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Doctor Zhivago is a moving story of love and romance told against the flaming background of the Russian Revolution. The story is presented through many characters whose destinies are interwoven. Not only is it a vast panorama of a country undergoing the most radical revolution in history; it also probes, with deep and desperate concern, the personal struggle of one man’s survival. The film stars Omar Sharif and Julie Christie. A poet, a surgeon, a husband and a lover - this is the story of Zhivago. Based on the novel by Boris Pasternak.

results.title: Pat and Mike
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn are sparring partners in this punchy comedy, of two good sports who stage a never ending romantic battle. Katharine Hepburn plays “Pat”, an all-round woman athlete who is a whiz at golf, tennis, baseball, basketball, boxing, archery and Judo. Spencer Tracy superbly enacts the part of “Mike”, an unschooled, rough-mannered Broadway promoter who already has a racing horse, and a heavy-weight fighter (Aldo Ray) as “clients” and who, possessing the top horse is now determined to have the “top woman”.

results.title: High noon
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman, Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A retired marshal is forced to take up his badge and guns again when a killer he has sent to jail returns to town, looking for revenge. The townspeople refuse to help and his new bride wants him to run away from the fight. The marshal meets the killer and his three accomplices at high noon in one of the most suspenseful and thrilling gunfights ever filmed. Starring Gary Cooper and Grace Kelly. Based on the story, “The Tin star”, by John W. Cunningham.

results.title: Morning glory
results.creator_credit: Lowell Sherman, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn collected her first Academy Award for her masterful performance in “Morning glory”. Cast to type as a garrulous New Englander who arrives in New York with one burning ambition - to be an actress - she delivered an effervescent performance. Based on the play by Zoe Akins.

results.title: Turtle diary
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Richard Johnson and CBS
results.brief_description: Popular children’s author, Neara Duncan (played by Glenda Jackson), fearing her creative talents have evaporated, escapes into the dreamy world of sea turtles, seeking inspiration in their beauty and grace. William Snow (Ben Kingsley)is a humble assistant in a bookstore where he too dreams of turtles. Outside of their chance meetings at the aquarium, they have little in common, but an inspiration to free the captive turtles starts a bond that gives their lives a new outlook. The “turtlenappers” are about to set their own spirits free. Based on the novel by Russell Hoban. Screenplay by Harold Pinter.

results.title: The Hustler
results.creator_credit: Robert Rossen and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Paul Newman is Fast Eddie Felson, the fastest-talking, sharpest-shooting pool shark in town. The film traces his struggle to gain the World Championship from the reigning pool king, Minnesota Fats (Jackie Gleason). Newman’s Fast Eddie symbolises the struggle of the down-and-out in America. The film features exceptional black and white photography (the cinematography won an Academy Award), and a witty, literate script based on the novel by Walter Tevis.

results.title: Lawrence of Arabia
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Sam Spiegel, Horizon (GB) and Columbia
results.brief_description: A sweeping, breathtaking epic covering the life of T. E. Lawrence who throughout his two years in Arabia during the First World War succeeded in uniting the Arab tribes against the Turks to become a legend in his own time, the great Lawrence of Arabia. Starring Peter O’Toole, Omar Sharif and Alec Guinness.
